@recordnepal @betimagic Also the concept of Chowk is different in Newa towns. It is a Khas adaptation of the term рдЪреБрдХ or рдЪреБрдХреНрд╡. These are open spaces enclosed by houses from all four sides with a path to get in, but not as same as Bahala or Bahee.

@recordnepal @betimagic Also, рдШрд▓ is not pronounced as Ghal but Ghala. It is Khas language orthography to write with a (рдЕ) syllabic ending and pronounce with consonant ending. However, Nepala Bhasa does not follow the same pattern.

@recordnepal @betimagic For instance: To add a locative case marker to рдХреНрд╡рд╛рдГрдмрд╣рд╛рдГ, would be рдХреНрд╡рд╛рдГрдмрд╣рд╛рд▓рдпреН or ablative case would be рдХреНрд╡рд╛рдГрдмрд╣рд╛рд▓рдВ.

@recordnepal @betimagic For instance рдШрд▓ shortens to рдШрдГ.

For example: The root word of рдХреНрд╡рд╛рдГрдмрд╣рд╛рдГ is рдХреНрд╡рд╛рддрдмрд╣рд╛рд▓. As a noun рдХреНрд╡рд╛рдГрдмрд╣рд╛рдГ would be used, but when adding case markers (рдпрд╛рдд рд╣рдирд╛ рд▓рд┐рддрдБрд╕рд╛, рд╡рд┐рднрдХреНрддреА) the root syllable of final alphabet is brought back.

@recordnepal @betimagic Nepala Bhasa is described as a language of short sounds. Old Nepala Bhasa didnтАЩt have any long sounds. The phonological process of dropping the last consonant and lengthening the vowel resulted in emergence of long sounds in Nepala Bhasa.

@recordnepal @betimagic Since, I am not from Yen, I am not sure if it is рдирдБрдШрд▓ or рдирдГрдШрд▓. 

If it is рдирдБ it would mean metal, but if it рдирдГ its root word is рдирдХ which means new.
